body:
LGTM -- let me know when tests are green and typos are fixed.

See if @bjchambers wants to sign off as well?

PTAL.
Went back and made the factories in PubsubXClient static classes too just to be consistent.

R: @bjchambers or @amitsela or really anyone.

References are [this dev thread](http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-beam-dev/201604.mbox/%3CCABqdQ5ZCm6W4_jDuOCzZ1FoAP5AbLHMc3t17PFY9uwpzumMmXQ%40mail.gmail.com%3E) which led to #179 fixing [BEAM-189](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-189). It has also be re-filed as [BEAM-230](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-230).
LGTM. I'll proceed with merging this.
R: @kennknowles
Alright, thanks all for reviewing! 😃  I'll merge it now.

Have you submitted your ICLA or are you under another CLA? I cannot find you in the [phonebook](https://people.apache.org/phonebook.html) or in the [list of ICLAs](http://home.apache.org/unlistedclas.html).

I don't think this contribution qualifies as "large" per our contribution instructions, so I will proceed.

But given the number of PRs you have to us, it seems good to get an ICLA established moving forward.

I think you can go ahead and rebase/clean up. I've got it working except for merging windows, but I still want to go over the code another time so I'll rebase on master then. 

By the way, for the batch windowing I'm completely ignoring triggers. Is this also what the Dataflow runner does? This essentially does a shuffle by key and window and merges elements using a `CombineFn`. (Except for merging windows where I can't do the shuffle by key and window but just by key.)

Jenkins test is failing IT test, is it running with the DataflowPipelineRunner - meaning as a Dataflow service ? If so, I think you miss an update there..
Just to save you the time:

(ed3676eda3f9031e): java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.beam.sdk.util.WindowedValue.valueInEmptyWindows(Ljava/lang/Object;)Lorg/apache/beam/sdk/util/WindowedValue;
    at com.google.cloud.dataflow.sdk.runners.worker.GroupingShuffleReader$GroupingShuffleReaderIterator.advance(GroupingShuffleReader.java:260) 

......

(9349dfed44f1940a): Workflow failed. Causes: (b529cf23ada96ef9): S04:WriteCounts/DataflowPipelineRunner.BatchTextIOWrite/Write/DataflowPipelineRunner.BatchWrite/View.AsSingleton/BatchViewAsSingleton/DataflowPipelineRunner.GroupByWindowHashAsKeyAndWindowAsSortKey/DataflowPipelineRunner.GroupByKeyAndSortValuesOnly/Read+WriteCounts/DataflowPipelineRunner.BatchTextIOWrite/Write/DataflowPipelineRunner.BatchWrite/View.AsSingleton/BatchViewAsSingleton/ParDo(IsmRecordForSingularValuePerWindow) failed.

It seems that [ValueInEmptyWindows](https://github.com/kennknowles/incubator-beam/blob/valueInEmptyWindows/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/util/WindowedValue.java#L257) is unused now, if we don't want to remove it yet, should we `@Deprecated` it ? or do you have future plans for it ?
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @kennknowles
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @dhalperi / @bjchambers
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @bjchambers
> "let me know when tests are green and typos are fixed." -- test aren't green ;)
Ah, yes, good catch. I will wipe out `ValueInEmptyWindows` as well. I think in our version 0.1 phase we don't need to go through `@Deprecated`, especially for things that are only used for runners.
Yes, ignoring triggers in batch is fine. I have a design to doc share about that as soon as I can patch it up...
LGTM
R: @dhalperi

LGTM preemptyively assuming tests pass.

Please self-merge.

> All checks have passed

@dhalperi :green_apple: :green_book: :green_heart: !!!
Submitted ICLA. Thought i had one, but I guess I didn't.
Rebased and updated according to the comments.
Per discussion with bchambers@ -- looks like you want to revisit this to put a message in display data that there was an exception getting the display data?
Generally looks good to me. Let's sync tomorrow over any remaining comments.
R: @bjchambers
+1 seems good except for the comment by @swegner

Rebased and updated to move the dependencies definition in the top level pom.

About the license, the JmsIO dependencies are Apache projects (Apache ActiveMQ and Apache Geronimo), so it's already under Apache license.
LGTM
OK. LGTM. Will merge.
LGTM. I like this style.
Good job. Let me take a look and try it. Thanks @manuzhang !

Wow! We didn't expect it this fast!

We'll take a look shortly, but it might take us a few days to parse through.

R: @davorbonaci
Tested sink in an app.

R: @dhalperi , I could reproduce this by adding an extra cosumer.poll() after 'closed' flag was seen in consumerPollLoop(). I could not reproduce the problem without extra poll. 

With that, verified both that the fix works and in case the thread takes much longer, close() properly waits for it to shutdown with periodic warning log. 

Raghu.
LGTM. Will merge.
R: @kennknowles
Code LGTM. Will merge when green. Testing changing contents underneath the evaluator is probably better than just checking readiness, but this improves the testing status quo so I say move forward.
LGTM, will merge soon.

PTAL
Beefed up unit testing for batching, though it's fragile due to direct runner's own choices on how to bundle.
Added display metadata.
LGTM
R: @dhalperi , I forgot to add this to your queue.

PTAL
Undid much of the 'if window is global-window-like then don't X' and replaced with
- onTimeBehavior controls ON_TIME pane firing, so can FIRE_IF_NON_EMPTY if you wish
- paneIndexBehavior controls getIndex value, so can ZERO if you wish
  Then all per-key state will be cleared if discarding fired panes.
PTAL
Takes ~1.5m to build the direct runner + run the additional RunnableOnService Tests on Jenkins; about 2-3 on the slower travis targets.

R: @kennknowles 
After merge of #326

Nice. Since we will, afterwards, be removing the test runs of the current `DirectPipelineRunner`, the change in build time will be reduced. I think we can merge this straight away. If we encounter any problems it will be easy to revert and/or disable selected tests.
It does seem that the cost on travis is much greater.

You can actually do the disabling of redundant tests in this PR by adding `<excludedGroups>org.apache.beam.testing.RunnableOnService</excludedGroups>` to the `sdks/java/` test configuration. Then we will have an even better idea of the test timing.
Gearpump requires Java 8 so the test matrix for Java 7 will fail.
Thanks. Merging.

@amitsela the changes to `PAssert` here actually cause [some Spark runner failures](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/1141/org.apache.beam$spark-runner/#showFailuresLink). I cherry-picked [just the `PAssert` changes](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/329/files) to be sure, and it [appears the same](https://travis-ci.org/kennknowles/incubator-beam/builds/129791838).

Given that this shouldn't actually be a semantic change, my thought is that there might be something going on with null values in the Spark runner as well (possibly causing a no-op `PAssert`?). It looks like some `PCollectionView` is not set when it is read as a side input in the `PAssert`, but after 5 minutes of looking around I don't have a clear idea what I'd need to do. I hope you don't mind, but to unblock things I think I will disable these tests temporarily as I think they were falsely passing before.
Just checking that Jenkins has the same failures with just this change.

I saw this as well in the Flink tests. Once I fixed the `null` value handling and side inputs I saw a lot more failing tests. I thinks what we need is a test that only verifies that null values work, one that checks whether a `PAssert` properly fails when it should and one that checks whether they succeed when they should.
LGTM. I think it is time to merge this.

The existing `PAssertTest` might have enough (but maybe could have more) but it requires this PR (for Flink) and #294 (for Spark). Side note: We'd like to have a `PAssert` that can run without side input support, when possible, so runners can get signal earlier.
If I take your prior comments as "LGTM" I will merge when Travis finishes up.

Ah yes, I wasn't aware that we really need so see the actual text "LGTM". 😉 

I also have #328 which fixes the remaining tests. It got a bit more complicated than I though, especially getting `CombineFnWithContext` with windowed side inputs and side outputs to work was a bit of a PITA. I'll rebase that one once you merge this here PR.
ping @kennknowles :)
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @dhalperi
@bjchambers is out-of-office, @lukecwik can you take a look?
R: @tgroh
LGTM
Let me have a look, I think I could help you with this one without disabling the tests - get back to you with an answer soon..

Thanks @tgroh.

@dhalperi, can you give final approval and merge?
@tgroh, want to take a pass at this one?
/cc @tgroh
This is actually a blocker for PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/329 correct ? Moving this there, I have a solution but a couple of questions as well.
LGTM, merged

In Spark (streaming), in order to invoke the transformation that actually executes the "RunChecks", we need to create an element to use as the "trigger" for this transformation (it won't execute on no-data).
I think it's the same for Beam and probably because it's the same for Cloud Dataflow, that's why `OneSideInputAssert` for example used to apply `Void`.
In https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/runners/spark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/spark/translation/streaming/StreamingTransformTranslator.java#L140 I take this special use case into consideration just for PAsserts.
So `null` input with `VoidCoder` was OK for the Spark runner.
I think this just allows the Spark runner to ignore the special `null` case
Anyway, I can fix this, would it be OK to push into this PR branch ? or you could just remove the special handling of `VoidCoder` and simply use `setDStreamFromQueue`

Oh, got it, #329 was just a demo, but I actually think this small change has an affect on all runners...
Maybe it should actually be a PR on it's own ?
Does not compile.

I don't quite understand why switching from `null` to `0` causes the failures, but any fix is great. You could pull this branch and add your fix, or just PR your fix. Or has my change broken something in an expected way? I will upgrade this PR to more than a demo if that makes sense.

I was hoping this change would actually make things easier for all runners by basing `PAssert` on things that are more likely to be universally supported from an early stage of runner development.

(side inputs are a much bigger requirement, of course, and I am thinking about how to alleviate that)
Will this now succeed even if you drop a0376ff? That commit causes unrelated issues, so if your change now makes that obsolete, we could drop it and merge this instead of #291.

I think I was a bit confusing and verbose, this change did make things simpler, it allows me (as a runner developer) to ignore the special `null` case.
You'll see in my fix..
PTAL
R: @kennknowles

I can't seem to push to this PR, permissions issues. 
You can use PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/331 it's not "by the books" with the naming and all because I don't want to keep you blocked, and I do want to go to sleep 😄 
Feel free to use it or simply copy the code, what ever works best for you, I don't mind.
And just to be clear, this change did achieve the goal you were aiming for 😃

BTW as to the branches - this branch is on the `kennknowles` fork, so the best way to use it is to pull it down and then add to it, and push the result up to your own fork and PR from there, or PR back to this branch if you like.

Anyhow, awesome, and I will get everything all merged & rebased as appropriate.
LGTM. Will merge & rebase everything.
Great. Since this is one commit from a whole PR with many LGTMs and other feedback, I will go ahead and merge.
Forgot to mention: I still need to add unit tests for the checkpointing and ack timeouts. Will do that concurrently with the main review. Thanks.

Yes, it will work without that. All the other commits that change from `Void` to `int` are also obsolete. Same for the commits that introduce the special categories, but those might be useful for other runners. I'll make a PR that includes only the required commits from here, these should be:
- Add TestFlinkPipelineRunner to FlinkRunnerRegistrar
- Configure RunnableOnService tests for Flink in batch mode
- Fix Dangling Flink DataSets
- Add hamcrest dep to Flink Runner
- Fix faulty Flink Flatten with empty PCollectionList
- Remove unused threadCount from integration tests (not really required, but good)
- Disable Flink streaming integration tests for now
- Special casing job exec AssertionError in TestFlinkPipelineRunner
- [BEAM-270] Support Timestamps/Windows in Flink Batch 
- fixup, remove WordCount changes, remove KvCoderComparator code

How should we squash those. Or should we include each commit separately?
Great work @aljoscha 👍 I think it is fine to leave the relevant commits. You could squash all test-related commits into one commit. I'd like to take a look once you've opened the new PR.

I'll open a new PR with only the relevant commits in a sec. There is still the question of the failing Flink specific tests. I can fix them now, but if we remove them anyways because most stuff is now covered by the RunnableOnService tests then I'd rather not do it.

This is the list of tests that we currently have for the batch runner:

```
AvroITCase
FlattenizeITCase
FlinkRunnerRegistrarTest
JoinExamplesITCase
MaybeEmptyTestITCase
ParDoMultiOutputITCase
PipelineOptionsTest
ReadSourceITCase
RemoveDuplicatesEmptyITCase
RemoveDuplicatesITCase
SideInputITCase
TfIdfITCase
WordCountITCase
WordCountJoin2ITCase
WordCountJoin3ITCase
WriteSinkITCase
```

I would say that we only have to keep these:

```
FlinkRunnerRegistrarTest
FlinkTestPipeline
PipelineOptionsTest
ReadSourceITCase
WriteSinkITCase
```

These would basically test that source/sink integration and reading/writing from/to the outside world are correct. (The `RunnableOnTest` tests never have a sink, they always verify using `PAssert`, if I'm not mistaken) And also the plumbing of the runner and the pipeline options is verified. All the other stuff is already tests more thoroughly by the `RunnableOnService` tests.
I believe this is superseded by #328.
It seems there is still a small problem that leads to one test failing, I have not yet pinpointed it. I'll keep you posted.
LGTM and merged

Next steps:
- backport to Dataflow.
- write an end-to-end test and get it working here!
Also, R: @kennknowles.

This is really cool!

One thing that you can do to get a lot of automatic feedback on your runner is set up the `RunnableOnService` tests as in #319 (Direct), #291 (Flink), #294 (Spark). This will also help to drive which test categories we need to split into, so you can explicitly exclude tests of capabilities that are still under development.

I just rebased and actually looked closer at the test results. It may sound crazy but I looked at each one :-) and here is my triage summary (without looking at the code) in order of frequency:
1. `Create.TimestampedValues` missing a translator (note that it is composite)
2. `Read.Bounded` missing a translator.
3. Some null pointer exceptions in `ParDo` with side outputs.
4. Perhaps one real issue in windowed combine, not sure.

If a translator for `Read.Bounded` were added, it should also take care of `Create.Values` that is currently treated as primitive for the Spark runner and definitely `Create.TimestampedValues` should work too (I think it already should; a bit confused about that).
@kennknowles @tgroh is this important? I was told that InProcess is "done"
@kennknowles please don't leave Jesse hanging :)
R: @dhalperi
This is for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-282

Have not had a chance to re-scan recently. However, a PR like this should not be changing APIs inside of IO classes. Those changes should be factored out into their own PR for discussion. It's not obvious to me that this is a mandatory API for all IOChannelFactories.

In general, looks pretty good. Some minor comments here and there.

The only major one is factoring out the UnboundedSource doc change separately and to a wider audience.

Overall feedback:
- large CL, hard to review confidently.
- but I know you've been running pretty stressful integration tests locally, so I'm giving you benefit of the doubt there.
- unit tests are thin, looking forward to seeing the ones you referenced.
